benchmark_details.name: Parallel Idiom Datasets for Persian-English Translation
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces two parallel datasets of sentences containing idiomatic expressions for Persian-English and English-Persian translations, with Persian idioms sampled from a new resource that includes idioms and their meanings, along with evaluation of various models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of various LLMs and NMT models on idiom translation between Persian and English.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The datasets contain only 200 examples for each translation direction.

data.source: Persian Idioms resource containing 2,200 idioms and examples, with 200 sentence pairs for each translation.
data.annotation: Manually reviewed by native Persian speakers for accuracy and cultural relevance.

methods: Automatic evaluation using LLMs and NMT models
methodology.calculation: Correlation between manual and automatic evaluation scores.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better idiomatic translation and fluency.
methodology.baseline_results: Claude-3.5-Sonnet performs best in both translation directions.
methodology.validation: Manual inspections and evaluations by multiple native speakers.
